result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: V-Bond Request
from victim re bond

Defendant shall not have any direct with victim or victim's residence, may communicate by phone;  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

12:59 PM Defendant Michael A Klatt in court, in custody with attorney Katherine Marie Findley. NOT Eligible for SPD; Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael A Klatt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct with victim or victim's residence, may communicate by phone;  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Review hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
